contentList.content: Few gods truly take on the domain of song as their primary domain, for it is a domain based on spreading the influence of a deity that the cleric worships, with tunes about the servants and deeds of the god. However, gods of music and stories, such as Apollo, Odin, Lliira, and Milil, are more likely to encourage their followers to spread their influence through song. Many of these deities encourage their clerics to go to homes caroling about the good path their deity can set the worried people on, and make their lives greater as a result.

Inspire an ally to add a +[1] bonus to their next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>.

Through stirring holy music, clerics of the Song domain can inspire allies. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

You regain all your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="YMS_Resource_BardicInspiration">Godly Gospel</LSTag> after a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>.
Add a +[1] bonus to your next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>.
Add a +[1] bonus to your next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>.
You expend your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="YMS_BOOST_BARDIC_INSPIRATION">Godly Gospel</LSTag> when the effect triggers.
The bonus gained from <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="YMS_BOOST_BARDIC_INSPIRATION">Godly Gospel</LSTag> increases to +[1].
You expend your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="YMS_BOOST_BARDIC_INSPIRATION_COMBAT">Combat Gospel</LSTag> when the effect triggers.

Add a +[1] bonus to their next Attack Roll, Ability Check, or Saving Throw.

They can also choose a +[1] bonus to the damage their next weapon attack deals, or to their Armour Class for one attack.

Lures nearby creatures with a magical melody. Can't take Action, Bonus Action, and Reaction. Movement speed is halved.

The song ends if you are incapacitated or lose concentration.

The melodies you play can turn the tide in any fight. As an action, you can begin playing a divine concert, creatures within 60 feet of yourself that can hear you gains a Godly Gospel.

After using this feature, you must take a long rest before doing so again.

When you inspire an ally using <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_BardicInspiration">Bardic Inspiration</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="YMS_Target_BardicInspiration_Combat">Combat Gospel</LSTag>, you gain [1].

When you inspire an ally using <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_BardicInspiration">Bardic Inspiration</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="YMS_Target_BardicInspiration_Combat">Combat Gospel</LSTag>, they also regain [1].
Play your instrument to restore one of your Bardic Inspiration or Godly Gospel slots.

Your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> increases by [1]. In addition, if you have <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="YMS_BOOST_BARDIC_INSPIRATION">Godly Gospel</LSTag>, you gain [2] more use of it.
Godly Wondrous Gloves: Godly Gospel Depleted
The Godly Gospel charge granted from these gloves is depleted. A <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag> will restore it.
